com.gluonhq.charm.glisten.layout

Class MobileLayoutPane

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.Node
      • javafx.scene.Parent
        • javafx.scene.layout.Region
          • javafx.scene.layout.Pane
            • javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
              • com.gluonhq.charm.glisten.layout.MobileLayoutPane
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.css.Styleable, javafx.event.EventTarget
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    GlassPane, View

    public class MobileLayoutPane
extends javafx.scene.layout.BorderPane
    The MobileLayoutPane class provides a layout container that closely matches the typical layout of many mobile applications. It does this by providing what is essentially a BorderPane style of layout (minus the left and right sides), with the addition of a 'floating action button' that can be toggled and displayed in various positions.

    Note: It is anticipated that over time this class will be heavily improved as use cases are communicated back to Gluon. Please let us know what functionality you want to see!

    Since:
    1.0.0

      • MobileLayoutPane

        public MobileLayoutPane(javafx.scene.Node center)
        Creates a new instance of the MobileLayoutPane, with the given Node set as the center node (that is, the main node that will expand to take all available space).
        Parameters:
        center - The Node to set as the center node in this layout pane.

    • Method Detail

      • getLayers

        public javafx.collections.ObservableList<Layer> getLayers()
        Returns the list of all Layer instances that have been installed inside this layout pane. Note that simply adding a layer to this list is not sufficient for it to be displayed - the developer must call Layer.show() or MobileApplication.showLayer(String) for it to become visible.
        Returns:
        A modifiable list of Layers that are available to be displayed.
